hackathon-eligibility:
Only Open to UC Berkeley Students or those that apply by the deadline!
Target Audience:
100 Students, 30% MBAs, 70% Engineers and other departments
Graduate students and undergraduate students, attendance by registration/application
hackathon-requirements:
Submit Presentation and code by the end of the hackathon.
 
Text rendering library
hackathon-rules: All code and presentation work must be done at the hackathon. Only API and SDK setup may be done before the hackathon begins. Must accept Participant Agreement to get prize.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The most innovative idea determined by Walmart will get this award for next semester.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=2227 Piedmont Ave, Berkeley, CA 94720, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: (Value proposition & revenue model, go-to-market strategy, market potential,  team & needs, partners, validation through customer interviews)
(alignment between business model and prototype, iterations)
How well you can sell your idea!

hackathon-description-header: Work on cutting-edge AR hardware and APIs to hack novel solutions with a business model in mind.
hackathon-location-description: University of California, Berkeley - Haas Innovation Lab
